Facility.name: NASA's InfraRed Telescope Facility
Facility.address: Summit of Mauna Kea, C/O 640 N. Aohoku Place, #209, Hilo, HI 96720
Facility.description:
The IRTF is an observatory that currently houses a 3.0-meter telescope, optimized for infrared observations, and located at the summit of Mauna Kea, Hawai`i. The observatory is operated and managed for NASA by the University of Hawai`i Institute for Astronomy, located in Honolulu as part of the Mauna Kea Observatories. NASA provides the costs of operation and NSF provides funding for new focal plane instrumentation through the peer review process. Observing time is open to the entire astronomical community, and 50% of the IRTF observing time is reserved for studies of solar system objects.
